author: nevertrustahippy
title: A really useful start but a starter none the less.
review:
Notwithstanding the extra cost and increased brick count of this set over Lego's previous Thomas & Friends starter set, this set is a clear improvement over set 5554.  

As a basic starter, this set includes everything you need for your little builder to have a good train set straight out of the box.  There is enough track (at least for a toddler to be able to fit in the middle).  The railway accessories are sufficiently varied and functional to allow for multiple play scenarios.  Also having two characters allows varied roleplaying.  More and better accessories and the addition of a minifig are what have this set beating the more spartan, arguably too spartan, set 5554.

Looking at the parts in the set I feel they are particularly chosen. The variety of the parts makes the set a great addition to a Duplo collection.  The windmill (a little handle to turn), tipping bucket (MOC dump truck) and the pillars on the stop signal (making any house a bit more grand) are particularly handy parts to have for all sorts of Duplo creations.  Having two trucks/wagons rather than one (in 5554) can mix up the play a bit, especially if you add more engines later. It is a pity they don't have character faces though.  The station is also a nice piece with enough room for a few minifigs to wait for the next train.  

From a Thomas & Friends perspective I like that the set includes the two most important characters - Thomas and the Fat Controller.  The windmill is also a good inclusion as it's so recognisable from the TV series.    

The limitations of this set are pretty clear.  To really have a great train set you'll need more engines and additional track pieces to create something better than a single loop.  The main gripe I have with the Thomas & Friends Duplo overall is the lack of more varied track options across the sets.  

With all the Thomas & Friends Duplo out of production acquiring your dream train set may be difficult.  For a really intricate train set you may be better off with the Thomas wooden railway toys.  The current Mega blok Thomas range has good availability but its tracks and the scale of the engines limit its comparability with either the Megablok or Duplo ranges.  The obvious advantage of the Duplo Thomas & Friends sets is their comparability with other Duplo so you'll have no trouble creating a lively Island of Sodor even if it doesn't have a tremendously extensive railway.
